name: Jiri Matas
content: Jiri Matas Jiri MATAS My old home page at U. of Surrey Professor The Center for Machine Perception Department of Cybernetics Faculty of Electrical Engineering Czech Technical University, Prague Karlovo namesti 13, 121 35 Praha 2, Czech Republic Office: G1 (building G, room 1), see map Tel.: +420-603-140180, Fax:+420-2-24357385 E-mail: surname@fel.cvut.cz ORCID: 0000-0003-0863-4844 CV: Publications. Demos: (mostly outdated) Awards Students Teaching: Pattern Recognition, Digital Image Processing, Computer Vision Methods, Vision and Sports Summer School Service: Editor-in-Chief of IJCV, Associate Editor-in-Chief of IEEE PAMI (2009-2013), Programme Chair ECCV'04, ECCV'16, CVPR'07, General Chair CVPR'22, ECCV'22. Research: Visual recognition, Tracking, Image Retrieval, Sequential decision-making, Pattern recognition, Wide-baseline Matching, RANSAC, Face detection and recognition, Biometric authentication, Colour-based recognition, Hough Transform. Awards: 2022 Best paper award, @ BMVC, 33rd British Machine Vision Conference, A. Lukezic, Z. Trojer , J. Matas, M. Kristan Trans2k: Unlocking the Power of Deep Models for Transparent Object Tracking 2019 Honorable Mention for Outstanding Contribution Award, @ GCPR, 41st German Conf. on Pattern Recognition, R. Rozumnyi, J. Kotera, F. Sroubek J. Matas: Non-Causal Tracking by Deblatting 2017 Best paper award , 3rd International Workshop on Robust Reading @ Asian Conf. on Comp. Vision, M. Busta, Y. Patel, J. Matas: E2E-MLT: an Unconstrained End-to-End Method form Multi-Language Scene Text 2017 First place in the ICDAR Robust Reading Multi-language Task 2 - Script identification. Yash Patel, Michal Busta, Lukas Neumann and Jiri Matas 2017 Attila Kuba Prize: D. Barath, J. Matas, and L. Hajder: Multi-H: Efficient Recovery of Tangent Planes in Stereo Images 2015 Best Paper Prize at ICDAR, the 13th International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition (Nancy, France): L. Neumann and Matas J.: Efficient Scene Text Localization and Recognition with Local Character Refinement 2013 Best Paper Prize at IVCNZ 2013: J. Pritts, O. Chum, J. Matas, Approximate Models for Fast and Accurate Epipolar Geometry Estimation 2013 Best Student Paper Prize at ICDAR, the 12th International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition (Washington, USA): L. Neumann and Matas J.: On Combining Multiple Segmentations in Scene Text Recognition , presentation. 2013 Best Paper Prize at the Scandianavian Conference on Image Analysis SCIA : T. Vojir, J. Noskova and J. Matas.Robust Scale-Adaptive Mean-Shift for Tracking , presentation. 2011 Zdenek Kalal, a PhD student co-supervised by me and K. Mikolajczyk at the U. of Surrey, was awarded the ICT Pioneers Prize in the "Technology Everywhere" category for the TLD tracker developed during the PhD. 2010 My student Lukas Neumann won the Czech Master Thesis of Year 2010 in Informatics award. The work is summarized in our ACCV'10 paper A method for text localization and recognition in real-world images 2010 Outstanding Reviewer, CVPR 2010. 2009 My student (co-supervised with T. Svoboda) Karel Zimmermann was awarded the CSKI prize for the best PhD work in 2008 for his PhD thesis Fast Learnable Methods for Object Tracking. See the related PAMI paper . 2007 Best Paper Prize at Asian Conference on Computer Vision (ACCV). J. Sochman and J. Matas: Learning A Fast Emulator of a Binary Decision Process. 2006 My student S. Obdrzalek won the Doctorandus prize for the most innovative PhD work in the Czech Rep. 2005 Best paper prize at BMVC: J. Matas, S. Obdrzalek: Sub-linear Indexing for Large Scale Object Recognition. 2005 The CMP Team I advised of finished second in the ICCV 2005 Contest. 2004 Best scientific result prize of the Czech Technical University Prague. 2002 Best paper prize at BMVC: J. Matas et al.: Robust wide baseline stereo from maximally stable extremal regions. 1987 MSc thesis awarded the Chancellor's prize. Students: current: Radim Spetlik, Michal Neoral, Jonas Serych, , [Google Scholar], former: Yash Patel [Google Scholar], (PhD'23, thesis awarded the Dean's Prize), Dmytro Mishkin (PhD'21, thesis awarded the Rector's Prize and the Dean's Prize), Tomas Hodan (PhD'21, thesis awarded the Rector's Prize), Milan Sulc (PhD'21), Maksym Ivashechkin (MSc'21), Denys Rozumnyi (MSc'19), Tomas Vojir (PhD'18), Lukas Neumann (MSc'10, PhD'17), Andrej Mikulik (MSc'09, PhD'15), Michal Perdoch (MSc'04, PhD'11), Zdenek Kalal (MSc'05, PhD'11), Lukas Zich (MSc), Jura Trefny (MSc), Jan Sochman (Phd'09), Karel Zimmermann(PhD'08,MSc'04), Stepan Obdrzalek (PhD'07), Ondra Chum (PhD'05), Mirek Hamouz (PhD'05), Kenneth Jonsonn (PhD'02), Ulises Ramos Sanchez (PhD'01), Yongping Li (PhD'01) Publications: @ DBLP @ Google Scholar @ Arnetminer @ MS Academic Bibliometrics: H-index: 71 (WoS) H-index: 101 (Google Scholar) Citations: ~36000 (WoS) Citations: ~79000 (Google Scholar) 2018 2017 2016 till 2015 Selected: (recent work is best found on arXiv) Serych, J. and Matas, J.
